meanings.definition: To feel deep sorrow or distress.
meanings.sent1: She grieved over the loss of her pet dog.
meanings.sent2: He grieved quietly at the funeral.
meanings.sent3: The sad clown grieved comically over his fallen ice cream cone.
meanings.sent4: The old tree grieved as its branches were pruned away.
meanings.sent5: The howling wind grieved through the empty streets.

meanings.definition: To cause to feel sorrow or distress.
meanings.sent1: The news of the accident grieved her deeply.
meanings.sent2: His harsh words grieved his mother.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten grieved the dog by stealing its favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: The relentless rain grieved the farmers with flooded fields.
meanings.sent5: The haunting melody grieved the listeners with its melancholy tune.
